But lemme tell you...when I played it, I finished it in one sitting and was absolutely ready to play the second game. I almost finished the second game in one sitting as well. It's so hard to break out of the immersive universe and stop playing, and the humor in the game feels like the cherry on top. I have a massive regret with this game, and that's that I didn't play it sooner. I can't believe I kept myself away from this story for so long...and if you're not good at puzzles, don't worry. I'm absolutely horrible with puzzles. However, trust me when I say that you can most definitely solve these without help! They have a perfect level of difficulty to where you'll scratch your head, then go, "Oh! I understand!" and you'll solve it. This game is undoubtedly a classic, as is Portal 2. If you haven't played this game, you haven't given yourself the full gaming experience! This universe is so incredible as well, and as I said before, it's so immersive. I would absolutely one hundred percent recommend this epic experience of a game!!

I have now played this game twice, once on Xbox, and once on Steam, and it's about the fourth time I've seen the story all the way through. 19/19 would recommend!

Portal is, at first glance, a puzzle game where you use a Portal gun to solve puzzles to complete the tests in promise of a cake.

However, Portal isn't just your regular old puzzle game - it's an actually interesting game. 
The game's lore is really interesting as you go on about the facility and it's secrets once you've had a close call from your "inevitable" death. The dark humor sometimes made me laugh a little bit.

Valve has treated this game as a piece of art - the lore, the graphics, and the level design were all fantastic.

Go out there and buy this game.
